title: Lists
description: HTML Hyperlink is a word, phrase or image that a user can click on to jump to a new document or a new section within the current document.

body.raw:
# HTML Lists

9–12 MIN READ

## Agenda 1. HTML Lists 1. Unordered Lists 1. Ordered Lists 1. CSS Lists Properties 1. start attribute 1. Description Lists
### HTML Lists - There are 2 kinds of lists in HTML: **unordered** or **bulleted** lists and **ordered** or **numbered** lists.
### Unordered list tag pairs - An **unordered list** contains a list of items that don’t need to be in a particular order. - The `
    ` and `
` tags are used to create unordered or bulleted lists. - Items in the lists are added by using the `
  • ` and `
    • ` tags ```HTML {8, 14} showLineNumbers HTML Lists

    Most Popular Web Browsers

    • Mozilla Firefox
    • Google Chrome
    • Opera Browser
    • Microsoft Edge
    • Safari Browser
    ```
    ### Ordered list tag pairs - An **ordered list** is useful for presenting a series of steps that the user should perform in order. - The `
      ` and `
    ` tags are used to create ordered lists or numbered lists. ```HTML {8, 16} showLineNumbers HTML Lists

    Phases of Web Development Life Cycle

    1. Planning
    2. Analysis
    3. Design
    4. Development
    5. Testing
    6. Implementation
    7. Maintenance
    ```
    ## CSS Lists Properties
    - Set different list item markers for ordered lists. - Set different list item markers for unordered lists. - Set an image as the list item marker. - Add background colors to lists and list items.
    ### list-style-type property - The **list-style-type** property is used to define the style of the list item marker. - The following values below explains how to change the marker for unordered list items. 1. The **disc** value sets the list item marker to a bullet. 2. The **circle** value sets the list item marker to a circle. 3. The **square** value sets the list item marker to a square. 4. The **none** value will not display markers on list items.
    #### Disc value ```HTML {3} showLineNumbers

    Most Popular Web Browsers

    • Mozilla Firefox
    • Google Chrome
    • Opera Browser
    • Microsoft Edge
    • Safari Browser
    ``` #### Output
    #### Circle value ```HTML {3} showLineNumbers

    Most Popular Web Browsers

    • Mozilla Firefox
    • Google Chrome
    • Opera Browser
    • Microsoft Edge
    • Safari Browser
    ``` #### Output
    #### Square value ```HTML {3} showLineNumbers

    Most Popular Web Browsers

    • Mozilla Firefox
    • Google Chrome
    • Opera Browser
    • Microsoft Edge
    • Safari Browser
    ``` #### Output
    #### None value ```HTML {3} showLineNumbers

    Most Popular Web Browsers

    • Mozilla Firefox
    • Google Chrome
    • Opera Browser
    • Microsoft Edge
    • Safari Browser
    ``` #### Output
    ### list-style-type property - The following values sets the marker for ordered list items. 1. The **lower-alpha** value is used to set the marker of a list item in lowercase letters. 2. The **upper-alpha** value is used to set the marker of a list item in lowercase letters. 3. The **lower-roman** value is used to set the marker of a list item in lowercase roman numbers. 4. The **upper-roman** value is used to set the marker of a list item in lowercase roman numbers.
    #### Lower alpha value ```HTML {3} showLineNumbers

    Phases of WDLC

    1. Planning
    2. Analysis
    3. Design
    4. Development
    5. Testing
    6. Implementation
    7. Maintenance
    ``` #### Output
    #### Upper alpha value ```HTML {3} showLineNumbers

    Phases of WDLC

    1. Planning
    2. Analysis
    3. Design
    4. Development
    5. Testing
    6. Implementation
    7. Maintenance
    ``` #### Output
    ### Lower roman value ```HTML {3} showLineNumbers

    Phases of WDLC

    1. Planning
    2. Analysis
    3. Design
    4. Development
    5. Testing
    6. Implementation
    7. Maintenance
    ``` #### Output
    #### Upper roman value ```HTML {3} showLineNumbers

    Phases of WDLC

    1. Planning
    2. Analysis
    3. Design
    4. Development
    5. Testing
    6. Implementation
    7. Maintenance
    ``` #### Output
    ### list-style-image property - The **list-style-image** property used to specify an image as the list item marker in unordered lists. ```HTML {1} showLineNumbers
    • item 1
    • item 2
    ``` ```HTML {3} showLineNumbers

    Most Popular Web Browsers

    • Mozilla Firefox
    • Google Chrome
    • Opera Browser
    • Microsoft Edge
    • Safari Browser
    ``` #### Output
    ### list-style-position property - The **list-style-position** property specifies the position of the list item marker in unordered lists. - The **outside** value means that the bullet points will be outside the list item. The start of each line of a list item will be aligned vertically. - The **inside** value means that the bullet points will beinside the list item. The list item will be part of the text and push the text at the start.
    #### Outside value ```HTML {3} showLineNumbers

    To create a web page:

    1. Open a Text Editor (Notepad) or Source Code Editor (Sublime Text) program.
    2. Save the file as .html (File - save as - select HTML)
    3. Write your HTML code.
    4. Double-click on the saved file, and it will be opened in your default browser.
    ``` #### Output
    #### Inside value ```HTML {3} showLineNumbers

    To create a web page:

    1. Open a Text Editor (Notepad) or Source Code Editor (Sublime Text) program.
    2. Save the file as .html (File - save as - select HTML)
    3. Write your HTML code.
    4. Double-click on the saved file, and it will be opened in your default browser.
    ``` #### Output
    ### list-style property - The **list-style** property is a shorthand property. It is use to set all the list properties in one declaration. - When using the shorthand property, the order of the property values are: 1. list-style-type 2. list-style-position 3. list-style-image
    ### Start attribute - The **start** attribute of the `
      ` tag pair defines the start of the counting from specified number. ```HTML {3} showLineNumbers

      To create a web page:

      1. Open a Text Editor (Notepad) or Source Code Editor (Sublime Text) program.
      2. Save the file as .html (File - save as - select HTML)
      3. Write your HTML code.
      4. Double-click on the saved file, and it will be opened in your default browser.
      ``` #### Output
      ## Description List
      HTML also supports description lists. - A **description list** is a list of terms, with a description of each term. - The `
      ` tag pair defines the description list. - The `
      ` tag pair defines the term (name). - The `
      ` tag pair describes each term. ```HTML showLineNumbers

      Description List

      Web Page
      is a document commonly written HTML that is accessible through the internet or other network using a web browser.
      Website
      is a collection of related web pages, including multimedia content, typically identified with a common domain name, and pulished on at least one web server.
      ``` #### Output

      Description List

      Web Page
      is a document commonly written HTML that is accessible through the internet or other network using a web browser.
      Website
      is a collection of related web pages, including multimedia content, typically identified with a common domain name, and pulished on at least one web server.
      ### Credits This webpage was created based on lessons provided by **Rose Anne G. Cochanco** as part of Web Development subject.
